summary:
Hi, I'm a hospitality and tourism professional with extensive international experience. After a Chemistry degree at university I worked my way around southern Africa, retraining in hospitality and then again as a specialist tour and wildlife guide. I'm blessed to have gained so much knowledge and skills at work, and to have had truly amazing experiences and met wonderful people along the way. 
After reaching the top both in catering and in high-end safari tours, I came to Europe. Having 10 years experience here in hotel kitchens and michelin-starred restaurants, I'm ready for another challenge and keen to move into a management position. Out leading a safari tour (and providing all the catering) I'm my own F&B manager! I'm a specialist in forecasting, planning and controlling - not only the F&B but ALL aspects of the hospitality and travel logistics. Purchasing, ordering, budgeting - all the while using my excellent people skills to keep the whole group entertained, safe and enjoying a top-quality experience.
With me you get the full package - I'm hardworking, responsible and independent, strong in planning and organising, an experienced supervisor with great communication skills.  You can rely on me.

projects: [{'title': 'Taste the Waste', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': "As part of the activities of the environmental awareness group 'Milieu Defensie' , on 23 March I will be joining them as lead chef, preparing a dinner for 25 guests, entirely made from left over products donated by three Delft supermarkets. Normally this food would be thrown away because it does not match supermarket standards (bruised apples, etc) but it is actually perfectly good food to eat.
